paper.title: 2023年3月英语六级听力真题(第1套)

questions.question_text: Where does the conversation most probably take place?

options.text: In a kitchen.
In a restaurant.
In a food store.
In a supermarket.

questions.question_text: What do we learn about the woman?

options.text: She eats meat occasionally.
She enjoys cheeseburgers.
She is a partial vegetarian.
She is allergic to seafood.

questions.question_text: What is the man's problem?

options.text: Changing one's eating habit.
Dealing with one's colleagues.
Following the same diet for years.
Keeping awake at morning meetings.

questions.question_text: What do the man and the woman have in common?

options.text: They are both animal lovers.
They enjoy perfect health.
They only eat organic food.
They are cutting back on coffee.

questions.question_text: What did the man's boss complain about?

options.text: The man had an attitude problem.
The man made little contribution to the company.
The man paid attention to trivial things.
The man got a poor evaluation from his colleagues.

questions.question_text: What does the man say about some managers?

options.text: They make unhelpful decisions for solving problems.
They favor some employees' suggestions over others'.
They reject employees' reasonable arguments for work efficiency.
They use manipulative language to mask their irrational choices.

questions.question_text: What does the man think of being honest?

options.text: It is a must for rational judgment.
It is more important now than ever.
It is a good quality in the workplace.
It is more of a sin than a virtue.

questions.question_text: What are managers really interested in according to the man?

options.text: Smoothing relationships in the workplace.
Making rational and productive decisions.
Preserving their power and prestige.
Focusing on employees' career growth.

questions.question_text: Why do people admire sports stars according to the speaker?

options.text: They show genius which defies description.
They create very high commercial value.
They accomplish feats many of us cannot.
They bring great honor to their country.

questions.question_text: What do some sports stars do to give back to society?

options.text: They try to be positive role models to children.
They work in spare time to teach children sports.
They take part in kids' extra-curricular activities.
They serve as spokespersons for luxury goods.

questions.question_text: What is the biggest challenge for sports stars?

options.text: Being super sports stars without appearing arrogant.
Preventing certain athletes from getting in trouble with the law.
Keeping athletes away from drug or alcohol problems.
Separating an athlete's professional life from their personal life.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about weddings?

options.text: They are dreams coming true to the brides.
They are joyous and exciting occasions.
They should be paid up by the attendees.
They always cost more than expected.

questions.question_text: What do we learn about the wedding the speaker attended?

options.text: It was cancelled.
It cost $60,000.
It had eight guests only.
It was held in Las Vegas.

questions.question_text: What did the speaker advise her friend to do?

options.text: Postpone her wedding.
Ask her friends for help.
Keep to her budget.
Invite more guests.

questions.question_text: How did the speaker's friend respond to her advice?

options.text: She called it romantic.
She rejected it flatly.
She said she would think about it.
She welcomed it with open arms.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about temperature?

options.text: It determines people's moods.
It can impact people's wellbeing.
It can influence people's personalities.
It is closely related to people's emotions.

questions.question_text: What is the effect of warm temperatures according to research?

options.text: They make people more reproductive.
They tend to produce positive feelings.
They increase people's life expectancy.
They may alter people's genes gradually.

questions.question_text: What is one of the findings of the study comparing Americans and Chinese?

options.text: The Americans are apparently more outgoing than the Chinese.
People share many personality traits despite their nationalities.
People in the same geographical area may differ in personality.
The link between temperature and personality is fairly weak.

questions.question_text: What is the main concern about senior citizens in the United States?

options.text: The number of older Americans living alone is on the rise.
Correlations have been found between loneliness and ill health.
Chronic loneliness does harm to senior citizens in particular.
A growing number of US seniors face the risk of early mortality.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about loneliness?

options.text: Loneliness is probably reversible.
Loneliness rarely results from living alone.
Being busy helps fight loneliness.
Medication is available for treating loneliness.

questions.question_text: What is the best way to fight loneliness according to the speaker?

options.text: Living with one's children.
Meaningful social contact.
Meeting social expectations.
Timely medical intervention.

questions.question_text: What do we learn about the woman at the beginning of the talk?

options.text: She had a successful career in finance.
She wrote stories about women travelers.
She made regular trips to Asian countries.
She invested in several private companies.

questions.question_text: What did the woman decide to do after returning from her trip?

options.text: Buy a ranch.
Set up a travel agency.
Travel round the world.
Start a blog.

questions.question_text: What advice does the woman give to those who want to enter the travel industry?

options.text: Create something unique to enter the industry.
Gain support from travel advertising companies.
Try to find a full-time job in the travel business.
Work hard to attract attention from publishers.

questions.question_text: What does the woman think is important for a travel business to succeed?

options.text: Attracting sufficient investment.
Avoiding too much advertising early on.
Creating an exotic corporate culture.
Refraining from promoting similar products.
